intro: Brachyotum nutans, commonly known as the drooping brachyotum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often drooping stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals, and are arranged in clusters. Brachyotum nutans is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
